metadata.title: CVE-2017-3140 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
If named is configured to use Response Policy Zones (RPZ) an errorprocessing some rule types can lead to a condition where BIND willendlessly loop while handling a query. Affects BIND 9.9.10, 9.10.5,9.11.0->9.11.1, 9.9.10-S1, 9.10.5-S1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.14').
